pros: Care about the staff and the people they serve.
cons: Several buildings need to refurbished

pros: Easy to get a job
cons: 1. Leadership likes to micromanage. 2. They don't see the root of the problem or if they do they refuse to fix it in order to keep good staff. 3. The management team creates mental health problems for the employees. 4. Raises used to happen then stopped but they keep hiring people that turn just around and quit.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Prescott Valley, AZ
pros: Offered decent pay and benefits
cons: I worked at the CSU for just over a year. In that time we had 3 different site managers and 3 different Directors of Nursing. It was chaotic and unsafe for staff and patients. Nursing management was located in a different building and was rarely seen. Administration made promises that were not kept.

pros: Helping the patients and good coworkers.
cons:
Micromanaging leadership team made up of social workers who do not understand what goes on day to day. They cannot take constructive criticism from their nurses and techs who just want to improve their working environment and improve patient care/safety. 

ALWAYS short staffed. There is a reason for this although leadership blames covid. 

Benefits are mediocre at best. 

Charting system is not functional.  

Communications within the organization is basically through email only and inconsistent.

job_title: Food Service Worker in Tempe, AZ
pros: Excellent supervisor and staff that works as a team.
cons: I cannot think of any cons.

review_title: CEO change and fee for service in July 2019
job_title: Case Manager in Prescott Valley, AZ
pros: Line employees care about each other, for the most part.
cons: CEO change in July 2019. Fee for service arrived. Now everything is about money, productivity. Too many new managers, poor training.

pros: Teams works together, flexible hours, great families, and fairly compensated. Company looks to find ways to improve.
cons: Goals set for improvement are sometimes not put into motion. Redundant paperwork at times.

review_title: It's ok but not for long term
pros: Flexible schedule and times to work
cons: Constant workflow and deadlines can be stresful

review_title: Not a good place to work if you are an ethical clinician
pros:
If you owe student loans this site qualifies for student loan repayment.
If you just want to make money and don't care about patients
cons:
* Administration does not value clinicians
* Pressure to cater to NARBHA and Administration's desire to continue the money funneling system of mental health care despite adverse outcomes for patients and high turnover and dissatisfaction of clinicians as well as other staff
*Leadership with no management experience prior to WYGC and limited understanding of core psychiatric concepts
*Administration that puts absolutely no emphasis on patient care but total emphasis on satisfying state regulations
*Lack of integrity and ethics are the biggest contributors to job dissatisfaction and the excessively high rate of turnover

pros: Flexible schedule, decent pay for the area, the ability to help others in the community, freedom to choose how to spend your day.
cons: No chance of advancement or a raise, poorly structured, weak management, can not get an org chart to save your life, need to deal with lots of negativity and poor attitudes.  LONG hours..

pros: People work together as a team in a positive and healthy work environment.  Upper management strives to show appreciation for subordinates and has an open door policy.  When you are happy to go to work every day, you know you are in a good place.
cons: I don't see any cons to working here although there is some uncertainty in moving to fee for service and Integrated Care.

pros:
Proud to work for a Company who embraces quality, compliance, and providing best care possible to our community.    
Committed and Caring coworkers.
Flexibility in balancing work/life needs.
cons: Can be stressful working in community behavioral health and meeting all the demands and expectations of job.

pros: Good environment, great benefits, family first philosophy, constructive criticism, rewarded for achievements, appreciative management, positive reinforcement, open communication, casual environment, professional.
cons: Flavored coffee creamer is not provided :)

job_title: Case Manager in Prescott Valley, AZ
pros:
Caring Staff
Supportive Supervisors
Good work/life balance
Great co-workers
Interesting work/clients
cons: The only con I would really touch on is pay. Then again, they are non-profit.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Prescott Valley, AZ
pros: Customer service experience, worked on scheduling , crisis calls, all areas of managing a very busy office.
cons: Not enough coverage to take time off when needed.

job_title: Crisis Clinician in Prescott Valley, AZ
pros: Understanding leadership, great pay, opportunity for movement, wonderful philosophy
cons: The productivity with some jobs

pros: Helping the marginalized community maintain or create stability
cons: high case loads of unpredictable clients
